meanings.sent1: I was really cheesed when my brother broke my toy.
meanings.sent2: She gets cheesed when people talk loudly in the library.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't help but feel cheesed when my cat knocked over my glass of water.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise cheesed me off like a buzzing fly.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet cheesed me to the point of madness.

meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he was completely cheesed and couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent2: They cheesed up at the party and had a great time.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally lapped up some spilled wine and got cheesed.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to dance as if they were cheesed on joy.
meanings.sent5: The music made them feel cheesed in a delightful haze.

meanings.sent1: She felt cheesed when she realized the online offer was a scam.
meanings.sent2: He got cheesed into buying a fake watch.
meanings.sent3: The magician cheesed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The promise of easy money cheesed him into a risky investment.
meanings.sent5: The mirage cheesed the travelers into thinking they had reached an oasis.
